texts.definition: Levels or other enclosed gameplay areas that are constructed so they are experienced as the final part of a narration arc and resolves that arc.
markups: <style="Definition">Levels or other enclosed gameplay areas that are constructed so they are experienced as the final part of a narration arc and resolves that arc.</style>

Many games have stories or narration arcs built into them so that players experience a story in conjunction with progressing in the gameplay. <style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style> are those areas created to structure gameplay so that players by completing these also experience the closure of a narration arc.

The last enemies found in worlds of the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Super%20Mario%20series">Super Mario series</link></style> games are typically placed in isolated places which makes the players need to fight them in areas dedicated to this fight without the possibility of leaving before vanquishing the enemies. The same structure can be found in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:FPS%20Games">FPS Games</link></style> such as the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Doom%20series">Doom</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Half-Life%20series">Half-Life series</link></style>.

Each of the campaigns in the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Left%204%20Dead%20series">Left 4 Dead series</link></style> consist of a number of levels that players need to traverse. However, the last part of most campaigns requires players to make a stand and solve specific goals different from those in the earlier levels.

Rather obviously, <style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style> can be created with the same design possibilities as <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style>. However, to a certain extent, some <style="Link"><link="adventures">Adventures</link></style> can also be seen <style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style> of <style="Link"><link="campaigns">Campaigns</link></style>. An example of this is "Q1 Queen of the Demonweb Pits", which is the last <style="Link"><link="adventures">Adventure</link></style> in the "Queen of the Demonweb Pits" supermodule.

One typical difference between <style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style> and other <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style> is that they typically have more <style="Link"><link="challenging-gameplay">Challenging Gameplay</link></style>. This to highlight the <style="Link"><link="tension">Tension</link></style> in the finale, as well as potentially being the last piece of gameplay in the game as a whole. <style="Link"><link="boss-monsters">Boss Monsters</link></style> are typically encountered in <style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style>, but since these may be encountered in other places as well these are actually not a way to create or modulate <style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style>. Instead, the opposite can be said, i.e. that <style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style> modulate <style="Link"><link="boss-monsters">Boss Monsters</link></style>, since these may the places where they can actually be defeated.

<style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style> is a <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Narration%20Patterns">Narration Pattern</link></style>. However, since <style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style> are specifically crafted to be closures of narrative arcs, they do not work well in games that wish to have <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Never%20Ending%20Stories">Never Ending Stories</link></style>.

<style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style> can create both <style="Link"><link="levels">Levels</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="scenes">Scenes</link></style>, and when doing so they affect the overall structure of <style="Link"><link="adventures">Adventures</link></style> (or in some cases <style="Link"><link="campaigns">Campaigns</link></style>) by being explicit <style="Link"><link="closure-points">Closure Points</link></style>. They also typically affect <style="Link"><link="boss-monsters">Boss Monsters</link></style>, in providing the area where these can be defeated.

By ending narration arcs, and often having increase difficulty compared to earlier parts, <style="CurrentLink">Finale Levels</style> often provide <style="Link"><link="higher-level-closures-gameplay-progresses">Higher-Level Closures as Gameplay Progresses</link></style>.
